publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4613 Bill Butler: Students Stamping Out Sectarianism—That the Parliament welcomes the launch of NUS Scotland’s Stamp out Sectarianism campaign, supported by the Scottish Executive, which is aimed at combating sectarianism in Scottish colleges and universities and the communities in which students live; notes that the campaign incorporates posters, postcards, leaflets and the setting-up of a new website aimed at creating a wider awareness of the subject and educating students about the issue, and urges students throughout Scotland to sign the online pledge to challenge sectarian behaviour and attitudes. Supported by: Mark Ballard*, Rob Gibson*, Robin Harper*

S2M-4613 Students Stamping Out Sectarianism (lodged on 26 June 2006) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Sarah Boyack*, Cathy Peattie*, Shiona Baird*, Jackie Baillie*, Cathie Craigie*, Christine Grahame*, Maureen Macmillan*, Alex Neil*, Marlyn Glen*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Michael McMahon*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*
S2M-4613 Students Stamping Out Sectarianism (lodged on 26 June 2006) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Patrick Harvie*, Mr David Davidson*, Trish Godman*
S2M-4613 Students Stamping Out Sectarianism (lodged on 26 June 2006) Jeremy Purvis*, Marilyn Livingstone*

S2M-4613 Bill Butler: Students Stamping Out Sectarianism—That the Parliament welcomes the launch of NUS Scotland’s Stamp out Sectarianism campaign, supported by the Scottish Executive, which is aimed at combating sectarianism in Scottish colleges and universities and the communities in which students live; notes that the campaign incorporates posters, postcards, leaflets and the setting-up of a new website aimed at creating a wider awareness of the subject and educating students about the issue, and urges students throughout Scotland to sign the online pledge to challenge sectarian behaviour and attitudes. Supported by: Mark Ballard, Rob Gibson, Robin Harper, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Jim Wallace, Sarah Boyack, Cathy Peattie, Shiona Baird, Jackie Baillie, Cathie Craigie, Christine Grahame, Maureen Macmillan, Alex Neil, Marlyn Glen, Donald Gorrie, Mr Jamie Stone, Michael McMahon, Dr Elaine Murray, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Patrick Harvie, Mr David Davidson, Trish Godman, Jeremy Purvis, Marilyn Livingstone, Chris Ballance*
S2M-4613 Students Stamping Out Sectarianism (lodged on 26 June 2006) Irene Oldfather*
